methods.name: GOOGLE_APIS_HOST
methods.description: @const {string} Host to send with API requests.

methods.name: Transaction
methods.description:
Build a Transaction object. Transactions will generally be built for you by datastore/dataset. When you need to run a transactional operation, you use datastore/dataset#runInTransaction.

Reference: {@link http://goo.gl/n4oSjt}

params.name: conn
params.description: - An authorized connection to Google Cloud Datastore.

params.name: datasetId
params.description: - Dataset ID. This is your project ID from the Google Developers Console.

methods.name: begin
methods.description: Begin a remote transaction and identify the current transaction instance with the remote transaction's ID.

params.name: callback
params.description: - The function to execute within the context of a transaction.

methods.name: rollback
methods.description: Reverse a transaction remotely and finalize the current transaction instance.

methods.name: commit
methods.description: Commit the remote transaction and finalize the current transaction instance.

methods.name: finalize
methods.description: Commit a transaction if it's not finalized yet.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Retrieve the entities identified with the specified key(s) in the current transaction. Get operations require a valid key to retrieve the key-identified entity from Datastore.

methods.name: save
methods.description: Insert or update the specified object(s) in the current transaction. If a key is incomplete, its associated object is inserted and its generated identifier is returned to the callback.

params.name: entities.data
params.description: - Data to save with the provided key.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Delete all entities identified with the specified key(s) in the current transaction.

methods.name: runQuery
methods.description: Datastore allows you to query entities by kind, filter them by property filters, and sort them by a property name. Projection and pagination are also supported. If more results are available, a query to retrieve the next page is provided to the callback function.

methods.name: makeReq
methods.description: Make a request to the API endpoint.
